text: Hey! What is the best way to go about developing a recent posts module that displays posts from a certain tag?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions#blog-recent-tag-posts>

So I tried to follow it with this string of code:
{% set blog_recent_tag_posts = blog_recent_posts(<http://module.blog|module.blog>, module.tag_field.tag, module.recent_posts_to_display )%}
I have fields set for blog choice, tag selection and number of posts to show.... But it no longer shows any posts when I know when there are posts
What happens when you PPrint those variables individually — you will want to make sure that they are all returning the values correctly

`{{<http://module.blog|module.blog>|pprint}} {{module.tag_field.tag|pprint}}`
`{{module.recent_posts_to_display|pprint}}`
Yeah they show the right values
Can you show us what they are printing?

It's printing this:

(Long: 60788214170) (String: Site Assessment) (Long: 3)
Site Assessment is one of the tags
Sorry wrong link but the idea is the same

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions#:~:text=content.tag_list%C2%A0or-,accepts%20a%20lowercase%20hyphenated%20name%20such%20as%20%27marketing%2Dtips%27,-.%C2%A0%20Spaces%20in%20tag|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions#:~:text=content.tag_list%C2%A0or-,accepts%20a[…]keting%2Dtips%27,-.%C2%A0%20Spaces%20in%20tag>
the tag must be lowercase and hyphenated
Ah I see... Is there a way to convert the tag to lowercase and hyphenated thought the tag field?
Im not so familiar with the field itself — but you can just run some filters on it `{{module.tag_field.tag|lower|replace(" ", "-")}}`

Sorry for all the silly questions, but how would I put that into this string
`{% set blog_recent_tag_posts = blog_recent_posts(<http://module.blog|module.blog>, {{module.tag_field|lower|replace(" ", "-")}}, module.recent_posts_to_display )%}`
Because as is, it gives me a syntax error
No problem — just get rid of the braces
`{% set blog_recent_tag_posts = blog_recent_posts(<http://module.blog|module.blog>, module.tag_field|lower|replace(" ", "-"), module.recent_posts_to_display )%}`
or alternatively

```{% set tag = module.tag_field|lower|replace(" ", "-") %}
{% set blog_recent_tag_posts = blog_recent_posts(<http://module.blog|module.blog>, tag, module.recent_posts_to_display )%}```
Ahh it looks like I may have forgotten the `.tag` at the end of module.tag_field
Basically take whatever was giving you that tag string before and then just add those piped filters on the end of it
I tried both options and it's still not rendering
(also, the `.tag` at the end of `module.tag_field` actually throws an error so I tool that out)
I found my mistake... I had the `{% set` with `blog_recent_tag_posts`, but the `{% for` was still just blog_recent_tag_posts`blog_recent_posts`
However, it's not rendering all of the posts again rather than the selected tag
I got it!!!

I used the last code you had sent and updated it to `blog_recent_tag_posts` like below:
`{% set tag = module.tag_field|lower|replace(" ", "-") %}`
`{% set blog_recent_tag_posts = blog_recent_tag_posts(<http://module.blog|module.blog>, tag, module.recent_posts_to_display )%}`
But THANK YOU so much for your help!!!
Right on! Happy to hear its working now
In my modules preview, why are the main CSS styles not reflected ? is there any additional statement which we need to add on our meta.json of the modules ?
oh ok linked files
